    • Get Started: Chinese Version-Procedure

Get the Clinical Classifications Software (CCS) categories and description for ICD-9 and ICD-10 codes on procedures.

IcdPrToCCS.Rd

Clinical Classifications Software (CCS) for ICD-9 and ICD-10 procedure codes in clinical diagnostic data is a procedure categorization scheme.

IcdPrToCCS(PrDataFile, idColName, icdColName, dateColName, icd10usingDate,
  isCCSCategoryDescription = TRUE)

Arguments

PrDataFile

A file of clinical diagnostic data with at least 3 columns: "MemberID", "ICD", and "Date"
idColName

A column for MemberID of PrDataFile
icdColName

A column for ICD of PrDataFile
dateColName

A column for Date of PrDataFile
icd10usingDate

ICD-10 using date
isCCSCategoryDescription

Clinical Classifications Software (CCS) single level categories/description for ICD-9 or ICD-10. By default it is set to True.

Source

ICD-9-PCS CCS (2015)

https://www.hcup-us.ahrq.gov/toolssoftware/ccs/Single_Level_CCS_2015.zip

https://www.hcup-us.ahrq.gov/toolssoftware/ccs/Multi_Level_CCS_2015.zip

ICD-10-PCS CCS (2019)

https://www.hcup-us.ahrq.gov/toolssoftware/ccs10/ccs_pr_icd10pcs_2019_1.zip

Details

return Clinical Classifications Software (CCS) categories or description based on ICD-9 and ICD-10 codes

Examples

head(samplePrFile)
#>    ID   ICD       Date
#> 1:  B  5681 2008-01-14
#> 2:  A  9774 2009-01-11
#> 3:  B 44.99 2009-05-10
#> 4:  C 07.59 2009-01-21
#> 5:  B  0205 2008-07-06
#> 6:  B  8812 2007-06-27
IcdPrToCCS(samplePrFile, ID, ICD, Date, "2015-10-01", TRUE)
#>   [1] "Other OR therapeutic procedures of urinary tract"                                                                                   
#>   [2] "Other non-OR therapeutic procedures; female organs"
